argumentText:
ARGUMENT
y z

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | #P_sssucid | |- A C_ suc A |
| 2 |  | #P_id | |- ( Tr A -> Tr A ) |
| 3 |  | #P_id | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ) |
| 4 | 3 | #P_simpld | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. y ) |
| 5 |  | #P_id | |- ( y e. A -> y e. A ) |
| 6 | 2, 4, 5 | #P_trelded | |- ( ( Tr A /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) /\ y e. A ) -> z e. A ) |
| 7 | 1, 6 | #P_sseldi | |- ( ( Tr A /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) /\ y e. A ) -> z e. suc A ) |
| 8 | 7 | #P_3expia | |- ( ( Tr A /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ) -> ( y e. A -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 9 |  | #P_id | |- ( y = A -> y = A ) |
| 10 |  | #P_eleq2 | |- ( y = A -> ( z e. y <-> z e. A ) ) |
| 11 | 10 | #P_biimpac | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y = A ) -> z e. A ) |
| 12 | 4, 9, 11 | #P_syl2an | |- ( ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) /\ y = A ) -> z e. A ) |
| 13 | 1, 12 | #P_sseldi | |- ( ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) /\ y = A ) -> z e. suc A ) |
| 14 | 13 | #P_ex | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> ( y = A -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 15 | 3 | #P_simprd | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> y e. suc A ) |
| 16 |  | #P_elsuci | |- ( y e. suc A -> ( y e. A \/ y = A ) ) |
| 17 | 15, 16 | #P_syl | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> ( y e. A \/ y = A ) ) |
| 18 | 8, 14, 17 | #P_jaoded | |- ( ( ( Tr A /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ) /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ) -> z e. suc A ) |
| 19 | 18 | #P_un2122 | |- ( ( Tr A /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ) -> z e. suc A ) |
| 20 | 19 | #P_ex | |- ( Tr A -> ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 21 | 20 | #P_alrimivv | |- ( Tr A -> A. z A. y ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 22 |  | #P_dftr2 | |- ( Tr suc A <-> A. z A. y ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 23 | 22 | #P_biimpri | |- ( A. z A. y ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) -> Tr suc A ) |
| 24 | 21, 23 | #P_syl | |- ( Tr A -> Tr suc A ) |
| 25 | 24 | #P_idi | |- ( Tr A -> Tr suc A ) |
\
 The successor of a transtive class is transitive. ~ suctrALT3 is the completed proof in conventional notation of the Virtual Deduction proof ~ http://us.metamath.org/other/completeusersproof/suctralt3vd.html .  It was completed manually.  The potential for automated derivation from the VD proof exists.  See ~ wvd1 for a description of Virtual Deduction. Some sub-theorems of the proof were completed using a unification deduction ( e.g. , the sub-theorem whose assertion is step 19 used ~ jaoded ).  Unification deductions employ Mario Carneiro's metavariable concept.  Some sub-theorems were completed using a unification theorem ( e.g. , the sub-theorem whose assertion is step 24 used ~ dftr2 ) . (Contributed by Alan Sare, 3-Dec-2015.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
